question: [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Invalid UTF-8] If comment extraction includes invalid UTF-8 sequences in String values of FileCommentMap, can this cause panics during to_string() conversion or serialization, blocking compilation of governance proposals? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: MatchedFileCommentMap] [Normalization attacks] Can Unicode normalization differences (NFC vs NFD) in comment strings cause validators to generate different MatchedFileCommentMap contents, leading to consensus failures when comments affect code generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [BOM injection] Can byte-order marks (BOM) in source files shift u32 position calculations in FileCommentMap tuple keys, causing off-by-three errors in comment span matching and misattribution of documentation? (Low)

(Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Unclosed nesting] If nested block comments remain unclosed, do position spans in FileCommentMap grow unboundedly until EOF, potentially allocating multi-gigabyte String values for comment content? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: MatchedFileCommentMap] [Matching ambiguity] When multiple documentation comment styles precede the same language item, can the merging logic in MatchedFileCommentMap values concatenate them in non-deterministic order across validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Comment flooding] Can a Move file with a documentation comment before every token create millions of (u32, u32) entries in FileCommentMap, causing O(nÂ²) performance during range queries in match_doc_comments()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: MatchedFileCommentMap] [Match explosion] Can pathological comment placement cause every position in a 4GB file to have a matched comment entry in MatchedFileCommentMap, requiring gigabytes of memory just for position-to-string mappings? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: CommentMap] [Per-file overhead] Does each FileHash key in CommentMap allocate separate MatchedFileCommentMap instances, allowing an attacker to multiply memory cost by submitting many small files instead of one large file? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Span overhead] Can interleaved small comments create worst-case BTreeMap fragmentation in FileCommentMap, causing cache misses and compilation slowdowns affecting validator performance during framework upgrades? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Leak via mismatch] If documentation comments in FileCommentMap are never matched to language items, do they persist in memory until check_and_get_doc_comments() is called, allowing memory leaks in error recovery paths? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: MatchedFileCommentMap] [Orphaned matches] Can parser errors leave partially populated MatchedFileCommentMap entries that are never retrieved or cleaned up, causing memory leaks across multiple failed compilation attempts? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: CommentMap] [Session persistence] If CommentMap persists across compilation sessions for caching, can old FileHash entries accumulate indefinitely, causing memory leaks in long-running validator processes? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Error path leaks] During lexer errors that abort parsing, are FileCommentMap entries properly dropped, or can panics/unwinding leave dangling String allocations in intermediate comment storage? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Lookup complexity] Can an attacker craft comment positions that cause worst-case O(log n) lookups in FileCommentMap to degrade to O(n) due to BTreeMap rebalancing during concurrent insertions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: MatchedFileCommentMap] [Range scan cost] If match_doc_comments() performs BTreeMap range queries over large spans, can strategically placed comments in MatchedFileCommentMap cause O(n) scans instead of O(log n) lookups, slowing compilation? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: CommentMap] [Iteration overhead] Can a governance proposal with thousands of Move files cause CommentMap iteration in check_and_get_doc_comments() to take unbounded time, blocking finalization of protocol upgrades? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: CommentMap] [Clone overhead] If CommentMap (BTreeMap) is cloned frequently during compilation pipeline stages, can deep copying of all FileHash -> MatchedFileCommentMap mappings cause unexpected memory spikes and GC pressure? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: MatchedFileCommentMap] [Borrow conflicts] Can simultaneous mutable references to MatchedFileCommentMap during comment matching and immutable references during AST annotation cause borrow checker violations that panic in unsafe code paths? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: FileCommentMap] [Lifetime issues] If FileCommentMap references are stored with incorrect lifetimes, can dangling references to source file Strings cause use-after-free bugs when files are unloaded during incremental compilation? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/legacy-move-compiler/src/parser/comments.rs] [Type: CommentMap] [Send/Sync assumptions] If CommentMap is incorrectly assumed to be Send/Sync for parallel compilation but contains non-thread-safe internal state, can this cause data races or corruption across validator threads?
